info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 3 at 10:54AM CDT until July 3 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Lubbock TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of northwest Texas, including the following county, Lubbock.
* WHEN...Until 100 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1052 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated areas of moderate to heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen over the past 3 hours. - Additional rainfall amounts of a quarter inch to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lubbock, Abernathy, Wolfforth, Shallowater, Idalou, Ransom Canyon, Downtown Lubbock, Lubbock International Airport, Texas Tech University, Lubbock South Plains Mall, Woodrow, Reese Center, Slide, New Deal and Buffalo Springs. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON
